intro: Arivela microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaf arivela, is a species of flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and mango trees. The plant is characterized by its small, leathery leaves and produces yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a small, spiky drupe that contains a single seed. Arivela microphylla is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to the unique environmental conditions of its native region.
